item.title: Ethiopia: Without immediate funding, 750,000 refugees will have ‘nothing to eat’
item.description: UN agencies appealed on Tuesday for $73 million over the next six months to provide food rations to more than 750,000 people seeking refuge in Ethiopia.

item.title: Ethiopia: Loan from UN fund allows FAO to scale up fertilizers for farmers in Tigray
item.description: A $10 million loan from the UN’s Central Emergency Response Fund (CERF) will allow the Food and Agriculture Organization (FAO) to scale up the procurement of fertilizers to support farmers in the restive Tigray region in northern Ethiopia, the agency announced on Monday.

item.title: UN Humanitarian Coordinator ‘gravely concerned’ by escalation of violence in Gaza
item.description: The ongoing and serious escalation of violence in and around Gaza between Palestinian militants and Israel has claimed the lives of 13 Palestinians by Israeli airstrikes, including a 5-year-old child and one woman, informed Lynn Hastings, UN Humanitarian Coordinator in the territory.

item.title: Somalia: ‘We cannot wait for famine to be declared; we must act now’
item.description: Rising acute food insecurity in Somalia has caused more than 900,000 people to flee their homes in search of humanitarian assistance since January last year, the Food and Agriculture Organization (FAO) has warned.

item.title: Ukraine: Guterres welcomes departure of first grain ship, to help ease food crisis
item.description: The UN chief on Monday welcomed the departure of the first ship from the Ukrainian port of Odesa, carrying grain under the landmark deal signed by Ukraine, Russia and Türkiye, overseen by the UN.

item.title: Sudan: World Bank provides $100 million in emergency support
item.description: The UN World Food Programme (WFP) in Sudan has received a $100 million contribution from the World Bank to assist with critical emergency cash and food sustenance in Sudan.

item.title: Ukraine: UNICEF delivers life-saving supplies for over 50,000 children in Odesa
item.description: The UN Children’s Fund UNICEF, delivered supplies on Tuesday to help an estimated 50,000 children in the war-ravaged districts of Odesa, the crucial Black Sea port which Russia bombed on Saturday, just hours after signing a landmark deal to allow Ukrainian grain to reach millions of food insecure people across the world.

item.title: UN delivers aid directly to Haitians caught up in gang violence
item.description: United Nations humanitarian agencies have started delivering aid directly to people in Haiti following a recent spike in violence between rival gangs which has fueled a worsening crisis across the capital, Port-au-Prince.

item.title: Hunger still rising across East Africa, says new UN-backed report
item.description: Over 50 million people in Eastern Africa will face acute food insecurity this year, according to a new study backed by the World Food Programme (WFP) and Food and Agriculture Organization (FAO).

item.title: UNHCR alarmed by growing death toll among displaced in eastern DR Congo
item.description: As conflict grows in the eastern Democratic Republic of the Congo (DRC), the rising death toll and suffering of displaced civilians through brutal attacks, is cause for serious concern said the UN refugee agency UNHCR on Friday, which appealed for fresh funds to meet "soaring needs" across the country.

item.title: UN envoy calls for extension and expansion of ‘transformational’ truce in Yemen
item.description: The historic UN-brokered truce in Yemen has largely held for nearly four months, and Special Envoy Hans Grundberg on Thursday urged the Government and Houthi rebels to work towards renewing the “transformational” agreement, which expires on 2 August.

item.title: Voluntary repatriation of refugees from Angola to DR Congo resumes
item.description: After a two-year hiatus, the voluntary repatriation of refugees from Angola to their homeland in the Democratic Republic of the Congo (DRC) has begun again, after the programme was put on hold in 2020 when the COVID-19 pandemic led to long-term border closures.

item.title: From the Field: Afghan earthquake survivors look to rebuild their lives
item.description: Afghans caught up in the devastating earthquake that hit the country on June 22, killing more than 1,000 and injured over 6,000 people, are sharing their traumatic stories.

item.title: Haiti: UN sounds alarm over worsening gang violence across Port-au-Prince
item.description: The UN human rights office said on Saturday it was deeply concerned by worsening violence in and around the Haitian capital Port-au-Prince and rising abuse at the hands of heavily armed gangs, against vulnerable local communities.

item.title: Ukraine: Guterres condemns deadly missile attack on Vinnytsia; more than 20 killed
item.description: The UN Secretary-General is appalled by the deadly missile attack on Thursday against the city of Vinnytsia in central Ukraine, that reportedly killed at least 22 people, far from the frontline of the main fighting in the east, including three children and wounded more than 100 others, his Spokesperson said in a statement.

item.title: Syria: Security Council extends cross-border aid delivery for six months
item.description: The UN Security Council has adopted a resolution to extend lifesaving aid deliveries into northwest Syria from Türkiye for a further six months following a vote on Tuesday.

item.title: Gang violence in Port-au-Prince threatens more than a million food-insecure Haitians
item.description: Surging and deadly gang violence in the Haitian capital has contributed to runaway food insecurity for well over one million people there, the UN World Food Programme (WFP) said on Tuesday.

item.title: Yemen: UN envoy outlines achievements and challenges in truce implementation
item.description: Although the UN-brokered truce between the Yemeni Government and Houthi rebels continues to hold, the key issue of road openings remains outstanding, while the country’s “humanitarian catastrophe” is set to worsen, the Security Council heard on Monday.

item.title: Ukraine struggling now, but winter will be even worse: UNHCR chief
item.description: While the Russian military advance in eastern Ukraine continues to escalate, the UN refugee agency, UNHCR, on Thursday warned that the winter months are very likely to be extremely harsh on millions of people affected by the war.

item.title: Sri Lanka's misery should be warning to us all on global food, fuel and finance crisis: UNDP
item.description: Countries already under pressure from the economic fall-out of the COVID-19 pandemic, risk seeing the same economic turmoil and human misery as Sri Lanka, with the war in Ukraine dragging on, unless the international community agrees to radical financial measures to help countries saddled with debt, the UN said on Thursday.

item.title: Record inflation and skyrocketing prices leave over 6 million Sri Lankans food insecure
item.description: In the face of record food price inflation, skyrocketing fuel costs and widespread commodity shortages, some 6.26 million Sri Lankans, or three in 10 households, are unsure of where their next meal is coming from, according to the latest food insecurity assessment from the World Food Programme (WFP), released on Wednesday.

item.title: World is moving backwards on eliminating hunger and malnutrition, UN report reveals
item.description: The number of people affected by hunger globally rose to as many as 828 million in 2021, according to a new UN report that provides fresh evidence that the world is moving in reverse, away from the Sustainable Development Goal of ending hunger, food insecurity and malnutrition in all its forms, by 2030, when the SDGs are supposed to be realized.

item.title: UN needs $68.4 million to help Central African Republic where 2.2 million are acutely food insecure
item.description: A sharp increase in prices of essential goods in the Central African Republic (CAR) linked to war in Ukraine, will likely have a devastating impact on the already dire humanitarian situation there in coming weeks, the UN World Food Programme (WFP) said on Tuesday.

item.title: As global food and fuel crisis deepens, Lebanon’s crisis is affecting ‘everyone, everywhere’
item.description: Veteran UN aid coordinator Najat Rochdi on Friday signalled grave concerns about rising humanitarian needs across Lebanon linked to the global food and fuel crisis, which are affecting “everyone, everywhere”.

item.title: Ukraine: Four months after Russian invasion, humanitarian needs intensify
item.description: Across Ukraine, the scale of needs caused by Russia's invasion is still massive and human rights concerns persist, UN humanitarians said in an update on Thursday, as they repeated calls for access to the country's Black Sea ports to export vitally needed cereals.

item.title: Syria’s needs are at their highest ever, says top rights probe
item.description: Syria’s humanitarian needs are at their highest ever and any move to block aid from reaching the war-torn country should be resisted strongly, a top UN Human Rights Council probe said on Wednesday.

item.title: Ukraine: Dozens dead and injured as UN condemns ‘utterly deplorable’ shopping centre attack
item.description: At least ten people have reportedly been killed by what Ukrainian authorities have said was a Russian missile strike on a crowded shopping centre, and attack which the UN condemned on Monday as “utterly deplorable”.

item.title: Countries urged to ‘dig deep’ and support Afghanistan in aftermath of deadly earthquake
item.description: The top UN official in Afghanistan appealed on Sunday for greater international support for the country, following a one-day visit to communities hit hard by the devastating earthquake on Wednesday.

item.title: Life-saving relief continues to reach quake-hit eastern Afghanistan
item.description: Emergency lifesaving aid relief continued to flow into quake-hit eastern Afghanistan on Friday, as UN humanitarians and partners rushed to help the most vulnerable communities.

item.title: Supporting UN’s Palestine refugee agency, means ‘investing in stability for the region’
item.description: Investing in the UN agency that supports Palestinian refugees, UNRWA, is also “investing in stability” for the entire Middle East region, the UN chief told a pledging conference on Thursday.
